answers.answer: Perhaps it is an attention grab? Or maybe she has a very weak bladder. I usggest you go to the doctor and ask about it.

It could be a sign of junior diabetes, but usually it occurs at night.  I would get it checked out.Another issue could be that somehow the teacher had embarrassed her or maybe scolded her for not going to the bathroom when everyone else went, maybe she didn't have to go at the time, and the scolding has made her scared to ask.  Or maybe she asked and was scolded and the teacher refused to let her go.  Reason I say this is because it happened to me when I was in the 1st grade.  I was a military brat living overseas and the teacher was a complete battleaxe.  After I was scolded for not going to the rest room when everyone else went she denied me and I wet myself.  I never did it again, but I remembered how mean she was.  The point is check into everything and don't rule out something that may have happened in class.

BTW, my 5 year old, will not use public bathrooms.  I did not train her that way, it was just something that came naturally to her.  She doesn't like 'unfamiliar' toilets.  I have to laugh a little.  But may also be that she doesn't like to use the bathrooms at school.  Make sure, like my daughter, that she uses the bathroom right before she goes to school.  Schools and teachers these days have too many kids to be patient with 1 unless it is a small class.  Good luck.  Let us know how it goes.
